block.p: Jessica Lyn Mackta and Brian Eugene Smith were married yesterday at Asbury Lanes, a bowling alley and nightclub in Asbury Park, N.J. The Rev. Carolyn D. Nicholson, a Presbyterian minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony

Ms. Mackta, 35, is keeping her name. She is the administrator for the outdoor signage group at Two Twelve Associates, a graphic design firm in New York. She graduated from Washington University in St. Louis and received a master's degree in the history of photography from the University of Arizona.

Jessica Lyn Mackta and Brian Eugene Smith were married yesterday at Asbury Lanes, a bowling alley and nightclub in Asbury Park, N.J. The Rev. Carolyn D. Nicholson, a Presbyterian minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony.

Jessica Lyn Mackta and Brian Eugene Smith were married yesterday at Asbury Lanes, a bowling alley and nightclub in Asbury Park, N.J. The Rev. Carolyn D. Nicholson, a Presbyterian minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony

Ms. Mackta, 35, is keeping her name. She is the administrator for the outdoor signage group at Two Twelve Associates, a graphic design firm in New York. She graduated from Washington University in St. Louis and received a master's degree in the history of photography from the University of Arizona.
She is the daughter of Jayne Mackta of Bradley Beach, N.J., and the late Barnett Mackta.

Mr. Smith, 32, is the associate art director at Visual Arts Press, a part of the School of Visual Arts in New York that produces publications, Web sites and signs for exhibitions. He graduated from Virginia Commonwealth University and has a master's degree in design from the School of Visual Arts.
He is a son of Charles Smith, of Green Valley, Ariz., and the late Patricia Smith, and a stepson of Jacqueline Smith.
